mobiles.name: kasabalý
mobiles.long_description: Küçük bir salýn içinde bir kasabalý görüyorsun.
mobiles.description:
This villager is dressed in a robe and sandals.
His hair is close cropped and he appears to be
staring into the distance. He is facing westward.
As you approach he says, "Beware the Goblins!  They
swarm like flies upon the unwary.  Beware!"

mobiles.name: gözsüz cüce
mobiles.long_description: Gözsüz bir cüce görüyorsun, seni izliyor!
mobiles.description: This Dwarf has been horribly mutilated.

mobiles.name: deli çora
mobiles.long_description: Delirmiþ bir çora görüyorsun, aniden saldýrýyor!
mobiles.description:
This çora is a young adult.  Obviously driven mad by
his capture and torture.

mobiles.name: þaþkýn genç
mobiles.description: This youngster is walking around in a daze.

mobiles.name: goblin çocuk
mobiles.description:
This goblin is green like all of the others.
It's hair is mussed, it smells, and has little
to no clothes on.

mobiles.name: erkek goblin
mobiles.long_description: Bir goblin erkeðiyle karþýlaþýyorsun, seni görünce muhafýzlarý çaðýrýyor.
mobiles.description:
This goblin is nearly naked.  He is wearing little
more than a loincloth, a few worthless bangles, and
some painted symbols on his chest.  They look like
circles with dots in the middle.

mobiles.name: kadýn goblin
mobiles.long_description: Bir goblin kadýný görüyorsun, varlýðýndan rahatsýz oldu.
mobiles.description:
She is very short..only 3 1/2 feet tall.  Long oily
black hair and a green complexion completes the image.

mobiles.name: goblin muhafýz
mobiles.long_description: Bir goblin muhafýzý görüyorsun, ölçülerini alýyor!
mobiles.description:
The guard is lightly armed.  He relies
upon his claws and fangs to do his work.

mobiles.name: goblin þaman
mobiles.description:
The Goblin Shaman is naked and completely
covered in symbols from his religion.
He doesn't notice your intense stare.

mobiles.name: goblin savaþçý
mobiles.long_description: Goblin savaþçýyý görüyorsun, saldýrmadan önce yardým çaðýrýyor.
mobiles.description:
This warrior is without armor or weapons.  He also is
covered in blue circles with dots in the center.

extra_descriptions.description:
The Goblin Nation area is designed for players
of level 10 - 25.   Please be careful when you
enter the Goblin Nation.  The lousy Goblins
travel in packs...and care nothing about honor.

"The lost, identified, must be revealed".

What this means is that you need to find that which is
lost, have proof, then tell someone on the wizlist.

MISSING - REWARD OFFERED
The brother of the Dread Pirate Roberts is missing.
A reward is offered for anyone who can locate the
brother and either release him, or tell someone on
the wizlist who has him and where he is.
This is an identification necklace.  It is number 1
This is an identification necklace.  It is number 2.
This is an identification necklace.  It is number 3.
This ring is for identification.  It is ring 1.
This çora ring is for identification.  It is ring 2.
This ring is for identification.  It is ring 3.
This toy is for identification.  It is number 1
This toy is for identification.  It is number 2
This toy is for identification.  It is number 3.

objects.name: peþtemal
objects.description: Bir peþtemal burada, yeni bir sahip bekliyor.

objects.name: goblin bilezik
objects.description: Bir çift goblin bileziði burada düþürülmüþ.

rooms.name: Duvarýn Ýçinde
rooms.description:
The river flows to the west, through the huge hole in the the
wall which encircles Malo Village.  The village is on the
north shore of the river to your east.

rooms.name: Nehirde
rooms.description:
The river is flowing quickly to the west.  You are outside
the wall which encircles Malo Village to your east.  Looking
about you notice that the land is flat to the west, but
mountainous to the northeast.  Tall grass borders both sides of
the river.

rooms.name: Batý Nehri
rooms.description:
Flowing westward, the river cuts through rich grassland.  The
aroma of growing things is strong here in the middle of nowhere.

rooms.name: Çim Okyanusu
rooms.description:
The river cuts through an ocean of grass, similiar to a current
flowing across an ocean.  No movement can be seen for as far as
you can see.  The four foot high grass varies in color from
light green to golden brown.

rooms.name: Küçük Köpüklerde
rooms.description:
The river flows over small rocks creating rapids.  Tall reeds
have replaced the grasses growing along the river bank.

rooms.name: Büyük Köpüklerde
rooms.description:
The river is picking up speed as it flows toward the rising sun.
Several of the rocks below the surface of the river have begun
to push their way towards you.

rooms.name: Akan nehir
rooms.description:
The river is slowing down and you have more time to look around.
River banks are covered by reeds, while in the distance you see
high grass waving with the day's breeze.

rooms.name: Çimenlere Doðru Ýlerleyen Nehir
rooms.description:
Large shapes slip beneath the waters as you travel by.  Tiny
birds flit about you because you are disturbing their habitats.

rooms.name: Köpüren Nehir
rooms.description:
The river is rushing westward, toward the horizon.  Reeds are
along the banks and the five foot high grass blocks your view
of the surrounding terrain.  A small mountain pokes it's head
out of the grass to the north of you.  It's bald pate reflects
the light.

rooms.name: Çimenleri Yararken
rooms.description:
Strands of grass, their roots washed out of the earth which
held them, float alongside you and are bunched into clumps
in spots along the bank.

rooms.name: Güney Virajý
rooms.description:
The river begins to curve south gently.  The high grass to the
north of you begins to look matted and misused.  The bald mountain
dominates the area as it pokes it's head out of the tall grass.

rooms.name: Güney Dönüþü
rooms.description:
The rushing river slams against a large chunk of bedrock and
is diverted in a southern direction.  The bedrock extends several
feet toward the river, creating a perfect landing.  To your
north, matted grasses have been woven together into a natural wall.

exits.description: A grass wall circles this area.

rooms.name: Güneye Yönelen Nehir
rooms.description:
The river is following an exposed section of bedrock and is
flowing in a southern direction.  The bedrock extends several
feet over the river creating a set of natural caves.

rooms.name: Köpüren Nehir
rooms.description:
The river is flowing is a southwestern direction.  The grasses
of the area are growing so tall they completely conceal the
terrain about you.

rooms.name: Güneye Yönelen Nehir
rooms.description:
The cold river, heavy with grasses stripped from the river bank,
flows quickly in a western direction.

rooms.name: Çimenli Kýyý
rooms.description:
This bedrock landing is concealed by a woven grass wall.  Matted
grasses cover the ground.  To the north a path through the high
grasses leads to danger.

exits.description: A grass wall surrounds the area.

rooms.name: Çimenli Yol
rooms.description:
This path cuts through five foot high grasses and meanders toward
the northwest.  Bald Mountain rises out of the grass to the
northeast and provides a point of reference for your travels
through the sea of grass surrounding you.

exits.description: A grass wall surrounds the area.

rooms.name: Yalnýz Yol
rooms.description:
This lonely path seemingly stretches forever through this sea
of grass.  Sounds of life can be heard to the northwest.  Inhuman
voices, metal on metal, screams of agony float through grass.

rooms.name: Çimenli Tepecik
rooms.description:
The path leads you onto a grassy knoll a foot or two higher than
the flat terrain around you.  Perhaps this knoll is part of the
Bald Mountain to the northeast of your present position.

rooms.name: çimenli Viraj
rooms.description:
The path curves to the west.  From here you can smell cooking food
and hear other activities associated with a small village.

rooms.name: Çimenli Tünel
rooms.description:
The grasses have been woven into a small tunnel...all light from
above has been cut out.  The tunnel is extremely small and will
only admit two or three persons at a time.

rooms.name: Goblin Vataný
rooms.description:
You are standing on the west side of a tunnel leading away from
this small village area.  To the west you can see several pathways
leading through high grasses. Several grass huts can be seen
poking their heads out of the grassy sea surrounding you.  To the
northeast Bald Mountain rises from the grass like a behemoth from
shallow waters.

rooms.name: Çimenlik
rooms.description:
The grass is matted and packed from hundreds of footsteps stamping
it into the ground.  A grass hut to your west reaks of unwashed
bodies and poor sanitation.

rooms.name: Kulübelerin Arasýnda
rooms.description:
This grass path is leading you inbetween two huts.  The hut to
your west reaks of unwashed bodies and poor sanitation, while the
hut to your north gives you the chills.  Death appears to surround
this hut like a dark shadow.

rooms.name: Goblin Kasaba Yolu
rooms.description:
You are standing in the middle of a small clearing in the center
of three Goblin huts.  The ground is sewage strewn and the grass
has matted into a disgusting heap.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This tiny grass hut is filthy.  Small pieces of food, ripped
clothing and broken pottery litter the floor.

rooms.name: Kenarýn Yanýnda
rooms.description:
Near the edge of a large grass wall are two goblin huts.
Peering through the grass wall reveals another path leading
west and east.  That path seems to be little travelled.

rooms.name: Ölü Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
The goblin that fashioned this hut was careless or stupid.
The grass was cut instead of bent and has now died.  It's
ugly brown color indicates it's dryness and begs to be
set on fire.

rooms.name: Mavi Kulübe
rooms.description:
You are standing in a hut which has been smeared with
blue berries.  The walls are caked with bits and pieces of
several different fruits but blueberry is the dominant color.

rooms.name: Çimenlerde Ýzler
rooms.description:
There has been so much traffic in this direction a rut in the
ground has been formed.  Several huts can be seen to the west
while to the south you can see four or five huts.  Bald
Mountain can be seen to the east.  It's rocky dome appears high
in the sky

rooms.name: Kanlý Yol
rooms.description:
Walking through this area is like walking through a slaughterhouse.
The grasses are soaked with both old and fresh blood.  The blood
trail leads to the west.

rooms.name: Kasaba Patikasý
rooms.description:
The path leads through the center of the village to the west.
Several huts are scattered around the area and are surrounded
by seven foot high walls of living grass.

rooms.name: Ezilmiþ Çimen
rooms.description:
This path through the grass plain is a main thoughfare within
the village.  Several narrow footprints can be seen in the mud
leading to the west.

rooms.name: Kýraçlýk
rooms.description:
The grass has been scraped away to reveal hard brown dirt
compacted by thousands of footsteps.  A small hole has been
dug in the earth and something is jammed into the ground.

extra_descriptions.description:
The "something" in the hole is appears to be a small white
skull.  Too small to be a Goblin or Human skull, this skull
appears to be an Elven skull.

rooms.name: Kamýþ Ev
rooms.description:
This stick hut is very small, dark and barren.  How odd the
walls appear to you now that you are inside.  Several of sticks
appear to be very smooth.

extra_descriptions.description:
The "sticks" are yellowing bones, collected from the
dead children of Malo Village.

rooms.name: Kamýþlý Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This hut is made from sticks and grass crudely woven together
into a weak semblance of a home.

extra_descriptions.description:
The "sticks" are actually bones.  They appear to be the bones
of several different races.  Looking closely you can see that
they have been gnawed.

rooms.name: Kayalýk
rooms.description:
This rocky spot has pushed itself through the grass covering
of the prairie.  Perhaps it is an extension of Bald Mountain?
A hollow sound can be heard when you step here and when you
look down you see a small hole.

extra_descriptions.description:
Putting your eye to this small hole reveals that beneath
your feet is a huge cavern.

rooms.name: Pencereli Çalý Kulübesi
rooms.description:
This tiny grass hut is cleaner than you expected and the
window comes as a great surprise.  Upon closer examination
the window is explained.

extra_descriptions.description:
The window has no frame.  It appears that someone clawed
their way through the wall of the hut.  Tiny pieces of nail
are still embedded into the frame of the hut.

rooms.name: Kayalýk
rooms.description:
A rocky protrusion has pushed through the ground and grass.  It
makes a hollow sound when you tread on it.

rooms.name: Çimenli Yol
rooms.description:
North of you a huge clump of grass blocks the way.  To the west
are several more huts, then a grass wall.  The wall blocks your
view of anything beyond it.

rooms.name: Kanlý Patika
rooms.description:
The path is splattered with fresh blood.  There is no sign
of a body or the source of the blood.

rooms.name: Kanlý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This was the location of a bloody killing.  There is blood
everywhere; on the floor, walls and ceiling.

rooms.name: Çimenli Yol
rooms.description:
This grassy path is small but well travelled.  To the south of
you is a path that circles back to the east.  North of you is
a high grass wall which blocks that direction.

rooms.name: Ýki Kulübenin Arasý
rooms.description:
You are walking between two huts, both of which are made from
the grass of the fields.  Far to the east you can see the dome
of Bald Mountain.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This grass hut is smaller than those you have seen so far.
Looking around you see signs that lead you to believe that this
hut is for children.  Several small piles of grass, looking much
like beds, are lying about the floor.

rooms.name: Güney Yolu
rooms.description:
This path travels along the grass wall which encircles the
Goblin village.  You can not see beyond the wall as it is too
tall, however, you can hear the sound of a rushing river not
too far away.

rooms.name: Düz Yol
rooms.description:
The path to freedom?  Hardly.  This path is used by the guards
in their circuit of the village.  It is heavily patrolled.

rooms.name: Çimenli Viraj
rooms.description:
This path leads to the north side of the village.  From here you
can see little ahead of you.  There must be several guards around
however, so continue with care.

rooms.name: Kuzey Yolu
rooms.description:
This path leads to the northern half of the village.  To your
west is a Goblin hut while to your east is a huge grass wall.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
The grass hut is small because of the two feet of grass covering
it's walls.  This thickness makes the hut very cool...blocking
the heat of the day.

rooms.name: Kan Lekeleri
rooms.description:
The blood spots on the grass about you suggests that someone
that is hurt could be nearby.  Looking around you see several
huts to the north.

rooms.name: Kasaba Patikasý
rooms.description:
This dirt path must be the oldest part of the village.  It
continues to the west until it meets a hut then appears to continue
in a southern direction.

rooms.name: Goblin Kulübesi
rooms.description:
This hut is unlike many of the others in the area.  It is
constructed of wooden poles with tightly stretched animal skins
fashioned into walls and ceiling.

rooms.name: Tozlu Yol
rooms.description:
Travelling along this dirt path gives you signs to dispell your
opinion that Goblins are creatures without intelligence.
There are several artistic symbols carved into the path.  They are filled with white pebbles to protect the design. You can tell that
no one steps on these symbols.

rooms.name: Kahverengi Tozlu Yol
rooms.description:
The dirt path is narrow and straight as an arrow. A hut to the
north shows a small light burning inside.  To the west you can
see a hut at the end of the dirt path.

rooms.name: Tahta Kulübe
rooms.description:
This wooden hut is well built from the planks of a sailing ship.
The weathered wood, the round windows, and a figurine of great
artistry makes this hut much more than you expected.

extra_descriptions.description:
The figurine is of a busty woman whose sly smile reminds you
of the forbidden fruit.  She's a real siren.

rooms.name: Tozda Çakýllar
rooms.description:
Small white pebbles in the dirt catch your attention.  The dirt
path is narrow but shows signs of heavy use.

extra_descriptions.description:
The pebbles are small and white.  Upon closer examination
you discover that they are teeth!

rooms.name: Pis Yol
rooms.description:
Trash, debris and litter covers the path and ground about you.
Many of the items were taken from Malo Village, while others
appear to be goblin made.

rooms.name: Kasaba Patikasý
rooms.description:
Travelling through the village on this dirt path you see that
the entire west side of the village is made of woven grass.
To the south of you is a large pit.  To the west a small hut.

rooms.name: Çukurun Kenarý
rooms.description:
You are standing at the northern end of a twelve foot deep pit.
A large hut has been built along the south wall of the village.

extra_descriptions.description:
The pit has been dug into the ground twelve feet down.  Several
log poles have been driven into the ground to support the walls.
A large clump of refuge at the southern end attracts your attention.
You cannot see the refuge from here.

rooms.name: Tozlu Yol
rooms.description:
The dirt path circles the pit and travels along the grass wall
towards the large hut to the south of you.

rooms.name: Çukurun Batýsý
rooms.description:
You are standing alongside the west side of the pit.  Several
stakes have been driven into the ground along the edge of the
pit.  Ropes are coiled near the stakes.

extra_descriptions.description:
The pit is very deep here.  A rope is hanging down the side
of the pit and at the end of the rope hangs a body.

The body is of a soldier from Malo Village.  His throat has been
slit and his toes and fingers cut off.

rooms.name: Çukurun Yanýnda
rooms.description:
The smell of death coming from the pit is almost overpowering.
A swarm of flies hovers above the pit.  A few of them come to you
to feast on your sweat.

extra_descriptions.description:
The pit is very deep.  Wooden poles support the walls.  Refuge
is piled several feet deep in the bottom of the pit.  The corpse
of a soldier hangs from a stake driven into the ground several
feet away from you.
The soldier is wearing a Malo Village uniform.

The refuge in the bottom of the pit is a combination of rotting
clothing, corpses, rotten food and several inches of blood.  A
shiny piece of metal reflects the light from the bottom of the pile.

Looking closely, the metal resembles a hook.  Yes, a hook.
You know...the kind of hook that replaces a lost hand.  You are
intrigued by this hook.  What is it doing here?

The hook is on the hand of one of the corpses.  The corpse
is dressed in the clothing of a sailor.  Looking closely at
the corpse you see that it was a man..and that he had gold
teeth.  If you know the identity of this pirate's brother,
please inform someone on the wizlist.  You will need to know
if the nature of the quest and the identity of this body.

rooms.name: Kirli Çimen Yol
rooms.description:
The grass path is covered with dirt from the pit.  To the south
of you is a large hut, built from the wood of a sailing ship.

rooms.name: Büyük Tahta Ev
rooms.description:
The wooden hut is built from the planks of a sailing ship.
Several round windows allow light and air to enter.  Carved
into the floor of the hut is a map of the continent.

extra_descriptions.description:
The map shows that the continent is shaped much like a cloud.
North central is Malo Village.  The river below the village
flows west and east.  To the west of Malo Village is the Goblin
Nation.  West of the Goblin Nation the river continues until it
reaches the west side of the continent and a large swamp.
The river east of Malo Village travels in a southern direction.
At a "Y" it continues to the east side of the continent and a large
inland sea.  The left branch continues in a southern direction
and cuts across the continent to the south west corner of the
continent.  In the center of the continent is a huge pyramid
shaped mountain.

rooms.name: Çimen
rooms.description:
This grassy patch survived the removal of all that dirt from
the pit.  Standing next to the grass wall you are able to see
how crudely the wall was constructed.

rooms.name: Kulübeden Önce
rooms.description:
This dirt path leads toward a shack to your west.  To the
northeast of you the village opens up.  Several huts have been
built in that direction.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This grass hut is a little larger than the others around you.
Looking around you discover several articles of children's
clothing tacked to the walls.  Some of the clothing is covered
in blood, while others look brand new.

rooms.name: Çimen Yol
rooms.description:
From this position you can see most of the village.  You can
count nine or ten huts from this position.  And you can also
see a small outpost on top of Bald Mountain.  Invisible from
most of the village, you can see a thin stream of smoke rising
from the summit.

rooms.name: Ýpeksi Çimen
rooms.description:
You are standing in hip high grass which caresses your legs
like the touch of silk thread.

rooms.name: Ýpeksi Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
Someone thought they had a good idea..building this hut out
of silky grass, however, they forgot to brace it up.  The
ceiling is nonexistant and the walls quaver with the slightest
breeze.

rooms.name: Gümüþ Çimen
rooms.description:
This patch of grass is different than all of the others.  It is
the color of silver.  Some of the blades of grass are as sharp
as the edge of a sword.

rooms.name: Uzun Çimenler
rooms.description:
This part of the village doesn't get much traffic.  The grass
is very high, almost as high as the wall which surrounds the
small village.

rooms.name: Bilek Yüksekliðinde Çimenler
rooms.description:
Finding this trail was a stroke of luck.  The grass is so high
you could have easily overlooked it.

rooms.name: Kulübeden Önce
rooms.description:
This path leads to the north end of the village.  Some of the
huts in this area appear to be very old.  Some are falling down.

rooms.name: Kamýþ Ev
rooms.description:
This stick hut is quite a surprise.  Once you enter you find
that there is no hut.  Only the front wall is standing.  All
other three walls have fallen.

rooms.name: Kuzey Yolu
rooms.description:
The path is leading you toward the northern most part of the
village.  Several of the huts in this area have fallen down.

rooms.name: Uzun Çimen
rooms.description:
You are standing in the middle of a path rampant with three foot
tall grass.  Without the nearby wall as a reference, you would
never have guessed that this was a path.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This hut is made of wooden poles with a layer of grass woven
inbetween them.  A thick thatch roof keeps out the rain.
Written in blood, on the wall of the hut is a phrase.

extra_descriptions.description: Made by the children of Malo Village.

rooms.name: Kuzey Yolu
rooms.description:
This grass path circles the northern part of the village.  A
hole in the grass wall surrounding the village provides you a
view of the grass prairie surrounding the village.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This hut doesn't exist.  Only the door's frame survived some
past disaster.  The floor is littered with bones.

rooms.name: Kahverengi Çimen Yol
rooms.description:
The grass all around you is dead.  Looking for the cause you
discover that the ground is hot..and that a thin trickle of
heated water is seaping through the ground.

rooms.name: Küçük Kulübe
rooms.description:
This small hut is well built and has a fire pit in the center
of it.  Several small hands are hanging on the walls.

extra_descriptions.description: The hands are from several small children of different races.

rooms.name: Çimenli Yol
rooms.description:
The grass wall curves in a southeast direction.  The path is
following the wall.  There are several private huts back here.

rooms.name: Duvar Yolu
rooms.description:
Long grasses from the wall have fallen into the pathway making
your footing very slippery.

rooms.name: Sýralý Yol
rooms.description:
The wall comes very close to one of the Goblin huts.  You will
have to travel in singlefile to get by.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
You are standing in a very small hut near the northern wall.
Some of the belongings in this hut were made by goblins, some
were stolen from Malo Village.

rooms.name: Dar Yol
rooms.description:
The grass wall is squeezing you into a very small path.  Some of
the grasses are hanging down into your path.  They brush against
your face as you walk under them.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This classic goblin hut is bare.  Now that you think about it...
most of the huts in this entire village are bare.  The only
possessions you have seen in quantity have belonged to the
Malo Villagers.  What is going on?  Where did these goblins
come from?  Where are they going?  What are they doing here?

rooms.name: Dar Çimen Yol
rooms.description:
This kneehigh grass path leads toward Bald Mountain.  The length
of the grass indicates that few Goblins come in this direction.

rooms.name: Tahta Kulübe
rooms.description:
This hut has been built from the wood of a sailing vessel.  The
weathered boards have iron rings embedded in them and a small bell
in the corner is very dull.

extra_descriptions.description:
Carved into the bell's stand is the name of the ship from
which it came:   "The Squid".

rooms.name: Yalnýz Yol
rooms.description:
This lonely path leads to Bald Mountain.  Looking ahead you see
that the path enters a dark cave in the side of the mountain.

rooms.name: Kahverengi Çimen Yol
rooms.description:
The dead grass around you signifies trouble.  Looking around
you spot a trickle of steam shooting into the air near the path.
Checking the ground you find that it's almost too hot to touch.

rooms.name: Karalýk Yol
rooms.description:
The dead grass has given way to solid granite.  The gray stone
pushes it's way through the earth and connects to Bald Mountain.

rooms.name: Daðýn Gölgesi
rooms.description:
Standing before one of the last huts along this path your attention
is drawn to Bald Mountain.  Standing in it's shadow..looking at
the cave mouth leading into it's depths, you begin to wonder why
the Goblins built their village here.

rooms.name: Maðaradan Önce
rooms.description:
The granite path leads to the mountain cave before you.  There are
several offerings placed at the entrance.  The offerings consist
of tiny piles of food, a few old coins, a sharp stick, and several
grass dolls.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
This grass hut is no different than any of the others.  Again the
question of "where are their possessions?" comes to mind.

rooms.name: Çalý Kulübe
rooms.description:
The grass hut was built somewhere else and moved to this location.
The grass is silver, and appears to be collecting light.  Looking
at the hut is hard to do...the light is so bright.

rooms.name: Maðara Giriþi
rooms.description:
You are standing in the entrance of a cave within Bald Mountain.
Several small offerings are scattered about the room.  To the
rear of the room is a door.  A door which doesn't open.
